Package cs735_835.noc

Interface Core

public interface Core
A network core. Each core is both a source and a sink for messages. Cores inject new messages into the network. They also store all the messages they receive for later analysis. Conceptually, each core maintains a queue of messages generated that are waiting to be sent. This queue is used by the router associated with this core.
See Also:
Network

    boolean isActive()
    Core activity.

    void scheduleMessage​(Message message)
    Makes the core generate a message, potentially in the future.

  • Method Details

    • scheduleMessage

      void scheduleMessage​(Message message)
      Makes the core generate a message, potentially in the future. If the message has a scheduled time in the past (or present), it will be added to the core queue at the next processing step. Otherwise, it will be stored until it's ready to be added (i.e., when the network clock reaches the right value).

      If several messages are scheduled to be generated at the same time, they will be added to the core queue in the order of their ids, which may not be the order in which they were injected using this method.

      Note that this method could make an inactive core active again. Typically, though, it is called to load a core before a simulation starts. Method Network.injectMessage uses it.

      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the message's source row and column do not correspond to this core.
      See Also:
      Network.injectMessage(Message)

    • isActive

      boolean isActive()
      Core activity.
      Returns:
      true if the core is active; a core is active if it has pending messages in its queue or will add messages to its queue later (based on previous calls to scheduleMessage).
      See Also:
      scheduleMessage(Message)

    • process

      void process()
      Processes the core. This simulates message generation. This methods injects new messages into the core queue (based on previous calls to scheduleMessage). Those messages are timestamped with a sending time equal to the current network time.

      Furthermore, if any of the new injected messages is marked as tracked, a short message is displayed on System.err.

      See Also:
      scheduleMessage(Message), Message.isTracked()

    • receivedMessages

      Collection<Message> receivedMessages()
      Received messages.
      Returns:
      a collection of all the messages received by this core. It contains the messages in the order in which they were received by the core.
